sen.j: 和裁（わさい）は、和服を制作することやその技術のこと。
sen.e: Wasai is the making of wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes) or the technique in the making.
Wasai is the making of wafuku (Japanese traditional clothing) or the technique that's employed.
Wasai is the making of wafuku (Japanese traditional clothing) or the technique that is employed.

sen.j: 和裁は和服裁縫の略語。
sen.e: Wasai is an abbreviation for 'wafukusaiho.'
Wasai is an abbreviation for 'wafukusaiho.'
Wasai is an abbreviation for 'wafukusaiho.'

sen.j: 大正時代の頃までは、裁縫といえば和裁のことであったが、洋裁と区別するために、和服の裁縫のことを和服裁縫、または和裁と呼ぶようになった。
sen.e: Until the Taisho Period, "saiho" (sewing) meant wasai, but in order to distinguish between "yosai" (dressmaking), sewing wafuku came to be referred to as 'wafukusaiho' or 'wasai.'
Until the Taisho period, "saiho" (sewing) meant wasai, but in order to distinguish between "yosai" (dressmaking), sewing wafuku came to be referred to as 'wafukusaiho' or 'wasai.'
Until the Taisho period, "saiho" (sewing) meant wasai, but in order to distinguish between "yosai" (dressmaking), sewing wafuku came to be referred to as 'wafukusaiho' or 'wasai.'

sen.j: 現在「裁縫」という言葉は和裁・洋裁のどちらも含む総称である。
sen.e: In the present-day, the word 'saiho' is a general term that includes both wasai and yosai.
In the present day, the word 'saiho' is a general term that includes wasai and yosai.
In the present day, the word 'saiho' is a general term that includes wasai and yosai.

sen.j: 裁縫のことを「仕立て」ともいう。
sen.e: Saiho is also referred to as 'shitate.'
Saiho is also referred to as 'shitate.'
Saiho is also referred to as 'shitate.'

sen.j: 和裁の特徴
sen.e: Characteristics of wasai
Characteristics of wasai
Characteristics of wasai

sen.j: 洋服の場合は、既製品であっても、着る人のそれぞれの体型に合わせてサイズの異なる服が作られる。
sen.e: In the case of western clothing, even if they are ready-made, clothes in different sizes are made according to the body shape of each wearer.
In the case of Western clothing, even if they are ready-made, clothes in different sizes are made according to the wear's particular body shape.
In the case of Western clothing, even if they are ready-made, clothes in different sizes are made according to the wear's particular body shape.

sen.j: 一方、和服の既製品の場合は、袴と足袋を除けば、子供用・大人の男性用・大人の女性用の3つの標準寸法があるだけである。
sen.e: On the other hand, in the case of ready-made wafuku, with the exception of hakama (a formal divided skirt for men) and tabi (split-toe socks), there are only three standard sizes - for children, for adult males, and for adult women.

Contrastingly, in the case of ready-made wafuku, with the exception of hakama (a formal divided skirt for men) and tabi (split-toe socks), there are only three standard sizes: for children, adult men and adult women.

Contrastingly, in the case of ready-made wafuku, with the exception of hakama (a formal divided skirt for men) and tabi (split-toe socks), there are only three standard sizes: for children, adult men and adult women.

sen.j: ただし、袴と足袋の既製品は種々のサイズが作られる。
sen.e: However, a variety of sizes are made for the ready-made hakama and tabi.
However, various sizes are made for the ready-made hakama and tabi.
However, various sizes are made for the ready-made hakama and tabi.

sen.j: 特別な体型で標準寸法の和服では合わない場合は、採寸して作られる。
sen.e: For special body shapes that do not fit into the standard sizes of wafuku, clothes are made by taking measurements.
For special body shapes that don't fit the standard sizes of wafuku, clothes are made by taking measurements.
For special body shapes that do not fit the standard sizes of wafuku, clothes are made by taking measurements.

sen.j: しかし袴・足袋を除けば、和服を個人の体型に合わせるのは着付けの段階である。
sen.e: With the exception of hakama and tabi, however, fitting wafuku to an individual is done during the stage of kitsuke (kimono-wearing).
With the exception of hakama and tabi, however, fitting wafuku to an individual is done during the stage of kitsuke (kimono-wearing).
With the exception of hakama and tabi, however, fitting wafuku to an individual is done during the stage of kitsuke (kimono-wearing).

sen.j: 女性用の和服では、裾の長さは腰の位置で折り畳むことにより調節される。
sen.e: For the women's wafuku, the length of the hem can be adjusted by folding the cloth at the waist.
For the women's wafuku, the length of the hem can be adjusted by folding the cloth at the waist.
For the women's wafuku, the length of the hem can be adjusted by folding the cloth at the waist.

sen.j: このように折り畳んだ部分をおはしょりと呼ぶ。
sen.e: The part that has been folded is referred to as "ohashori."
The part that has been folded is referred to as "ohashori."
The part that has been folded is referred to as "ohashori."

sen.j: 男性用の和服の着付けではおはしょりは作らない。
sen.e: Ohashori is not made during kitsuke for men's wafuku.
Ohashori is not made during kitsuke for men's wafuku.
Ohashori is not made during kitsuke for men's wafuku.

sen.j: 洋服にはないこの和服の特徴により、和服を新たに取得するときに、洋服よりもサイズを確かめる必要性が低い。
sen.e: For this characteristic of wafuku which is not seen in western clothing, when one were to buy a new wafuku, there is less need to verify the sizes than it is to the western clothing.
For this characteristic of wafuku, which is not seen in Western clothing, when one is to buy a new wafuku there is less need to verify the sizes than in Western clothing.
For this characteristic of wafuku, which is not seen in Western clothing, when one is to buy a new wafuku there is less need to verify the sizes than in Western clothing.

sen.j: また、親と子の体型がよほど大きく違わないかぎり、娘の結婚式などで母の高価な和服を娘が着るようなことが可能となる。
sen.e: Also, not unless the body shape differ greatly between the parent and the child, it is possible for the daughter to wear her mother's expensive wafuku, such as at her wedding ceremony.
Also, unless the body shape differs greatly between the parent and the child, it's possible for the daughter to wear her mother's expensive wafuku, such as at her wedding ceremony.
Also, unless the body shape differs greatly between the parent and the child, it is possible for the daughter to wear her mother's expensive wafuku, such as at her wedding ceremony.

sen.j: ただし、女性用の和服であっても、欧米の白人女性が着る場合、彼女たちは一般的に日本人女性と比べて背が高く、サイズが合わないことがある。
sen.e: However, even if it is a women's wafuku, when a Caucasian women of Europe and America were to wear it, the size may not fit, as they are normally taller than Japanese women.
However, even if it is a women's wafuku, if a Caucasian women of Europe and America were to wear it the size may not fit, since she'd typically be taller than a Japanese woman.
However, even if it is a women's wafuku, if a Caucasian women of Europe and America were to wear it the size may not fit, since she would typically be taller than a Japanese woman.

sen.j: 男性用・女性用を問わず、正装の和服は格調高く作られ、非常に高価であり、伝統工芸品・芸術作品としての価値が生まれることもある。
sen.e: For men or women, wafuku formalwear is made in a noble and dignified style; therefore, it is very expensive, and there are times when they bear values as traditional crafts and work of art.
For men or women, wafuku formalwear is made in a noble, dignified style; therefore, it's very expensive, and there are times when they bear value as traditional crafts and works of art.
For men or women, wafuku formalwear is made in a noble, dignified style; therefore, it is very expensive, and there are times when they bear value as traditional crafts and works of art.

sen.j: 普段着の和服は、工場で大量生産されることがある。
sen.e: Wafuku for everyday use is made in large quantities at the factories.
Wafuku for everyday use is made in large quantities at factories.
Wafuku for everyday use is made in large quantities at factories.

sen.j: 長さの単位に、メートル法ではなく尺貫法の丈・尺・寸が使われることがある。
sen.e: Jo (about 3.79m), Shaku (about 37.9 cm), and Sun (about 3.78 cm) of Shakkanho (old Japanese system of weights and measures) is used for the unit of length instead of the metric system.
sen.cmt: 括弧内の長さは鯨尺です。
sen.e: Jo (about 3.79m), Shaku (about 37.9 cm) and Sun (about 3.78 cm) of Shakkanho (the old Japanese system of weights and measures) is used for the unit of length instead of the metric system.
Jo (about 3.79m), Shaku (about 37.9cm) and Sun (about 3.78cm) of Shakkanho (the old Japanese system of weights and measures) is used for the unit of length instead of the metric system.

sen.j: 反物
sen.e: Tanmono (roll of cloth)
Tanmono (roll of cloth)
Tanmono (roll of cloth)

sen.j: 反物は、和服の材料となる織物の総称である。
sen.e: Tanmono is a general term for fabrics which are to become the materials for wafuku.
Tanmono is a general term for fabrics that are to become the materials for wafuku.
Tanmono is a general term for fabrics that are to become the materials for wafuku.

sen.j: 幅が36cmから72cm、長さが4mから26mある、細長い布である。
sen.e: Tanmono is a long and narrow piece of cloth with the width ranging from 36cm to 72cm, and the length ranging from 4m to 26m.
Tanmono is a long, narrow piece of cloth ranging from 36cm to 72cm in width and a length ranging from 4m to 26m.
Tanmono is a long, narrow piece of cloth ranging from 36cm to 72cm in width and a length ranging from 4m to 26m.

sen.j: 大人の女性用の長着によく使われるのは、幅が36cmの並巾と呼ばれる反物である。
sen.e: Tanmono that are often used to make nagagi (full-length garments) for adult women are called "namihaba" which has the width of 36cm.
Tanmono that are often used to make nagagi (full-length garments) for adult women are called "namihaba," which are 36cm in width.
Tanmono that are often used to make nagagi (full-length garments) for adult women are called "namihaba," which are 36cm in width.

sen.j: 女性用の長着を一つ作るには、12mほどの長さの並巾が必要である。
sen.e: A length of about 12m of namihaba is necessary to make one nagagi for women.
A length of about 12m of namihaba is necessary to make one nagagi for a woman.
A length of about 12m of namihaba is necessary to make one nagagi for a woman.

sen.j: 針
sen.e: Needles
Needles
Needles

sen.j: 和裁の針には、「紬えりしめ」「絹えりしめ」「木綿えりしめ」「大ちゃぼ」「中ちゃぼ」「小ちゃぼ」「絹くけ」「大くけ」「小くけ」「木綿縫い」「三の三」「四の三」「四の四」などが使われる。
sen.e: Needles including 'tsumugi-erishime' (a needle used for blind stitching the collar of kimono made with pongee), 'kinu-erishime' (a needle used for blind stitching the collar of kimono made with silk), 'momen-erishime' (a needle used for blind stitching the collar of kimono made with cotton), 'chabo needle (large)' (a rather thick needle for sewing cotton fabric), 'chabo needle (medium),' (chabo needle (short)', 'kinukuke' (a needle for blind stitching silk), 'okuke' (a long needle used for blind stitching cotton fabric), 'kokuke' (a short needle used for stitching cotton fabric), 'momen-nui' (a 3.6cm long needle used for sewing cotton fabric) 'san no san' (a 3.9cm long needle used for sewing cotton fabric), 'yon no san' (a 3.9cm long needle used for sewing silk), and 'yon no yon' (a 4.2cm long needle used for sewing silk) are used for wasai.
sen.cmt: 『初めての和裁 きものの仕立てと技術の基本』（大塚末子/成美堂出版）などを参考に致しました。
sen.e: Needles including 'tsumugi-erishime' (a needle used for blind-stitching the collar of kimono made with pongee), 'kinu-erishime' (a needle used for blind-stitching the collar of a kimono made with silk), 'momen-erishime' (a needle used for blind-stitching the collar of a kimono made with cotton), 'chabo needle (large)' (a somewhat thick needle for sewing cotton fabric), 'chabo needle (medium),' (chabo needle (short)', 'kinukuke' (a needle for blind-stitching silk), 'okuke' (a long needle used for blind-stitching cotton fabric), 'kokuke' (a short needle used for stitching cotton fabric), 'momen-nui' (a 3.6cm needle used for sewing cotton fabric) 'san no san' (a 3.9cm needle used for sewing cotton fabric), 'yon no san' (a 3.9cm needle used for sewing silk), and 'yon no yon' (a 4.2cm needle used for sewing silk) are used for wasai.

Needles including 'tsumugi-erishime' (a needle used for blind-stitching the collar of kimono made with pongee), 'kinu-erishime' (a needle used for blind-stitching the collar of a kimono made with silk), 'momen-erishime' (a needle used for blind-stitching the collar of a kimono made with cotton), 'chabo needle (large)' (a somewhat thick needle for sewing cotton fabric), 'chabo needle (medium),' (chabo needle (short)', 'kinukuke' (a needle for blind-stitching silk), 'okuke' (a long needle used for blind-stitching cotton fabric), 'kokuke' (a short needle used for stitching cotton fabric), 'momen-nui' (a 3.6cm needle used for sewing cotton fabric) 'san no san' (a 3.9cm needle used for sewing cotton fabric), 'yon no san' (a 3.9cm needle used for sewing silk), and 'yon no yon' (a 4.2cm needle used for sewing silk) are used for wasai.

sen.j: 和裁の糸には、絹手縫い糸、躾（しつけ）糸などが使われる。
sen.e: Thread such as 'kinute nui ito' (silk thread for hand sewing) and 'shitsuke ito' (basting threads) are used for wasai.
Thread such as 'kinute nui ito' (silk thread for hand-sewing) and 'shitsuke ito' (basting threads) are used for wasai.

sen.j: はさみには、裁ちばさみと糸きりばさみが使われる。

sen.j: 尺で計測できるものさしや、鯨尺で計測できるものさしがある。

tit.j: 厚生労働省の技能者表彰
tit.e: Official commendation of Technicians by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare.
Official commendation of Technicians by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare.
Official commendation of Technicians by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare

sen.j: 厚生労働省は、1967年度から毎年1回、推薦された者を審査し、卓越した技能者を選んで、「現代の名工（卓越した技能者）」として表彰・発表している。
sen.e: Once a year annually from 1967, the Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare judges technicians who had been recommended, and selects an outstanding technician, commends, and presents them as a 'contemporary master craftsman.'

Once each year since 1967, the Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare judges technicians who have been recommended, and selects an outstanding technician, commends and presents that individual as a 'contemporary master craftsman.'

Once each year since 1967, the Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare judges technicians who have been recommended, and selects an outstanding technician, commends and presents that individual as a 'contemporary master craftsman.'

sen.j: 「衣服の職業」という職業部門に、「和服仕立・修理職」という職業分類がある。
sen.e: There is a classification of occupation called 'wafuku shitate and shuri shoku' (tailoring and mending) under a classified category called ' Profession in Apparel.'
There is a classification of occupation called 'wafuku shitate and shuri shoku' (tailoring and mending) under a classified category called 'Profession in Apparel.'
There is a classification of occupation called 'wafuku shitate and shuri shoku' (tailoring and mending) under a classified category called 'Profession in Apparel.'

sen.j: 和服仕立職や染色工など、和服関連の職業の卓越した技能者が、今まで多数表彰された。
sen.e: Many of the prominent technicians in the trade related to wafuku such as tailoring and dying have been commended.
Many of the prominent technicians in the trade related to wafuku, such as tailoring and dying, have been commended.
Many of the prominent technicians in the trade related to wafuku, such as tailoring and dying, have been commended.
